reasoning: ALS1 is an autosomal recessive genetic form of ALS, extremely rare compared to sporadic disease. Accounts for <5% of familial ALS cases globally. Incidence data not systematically captured in epidemiological studies; estimate based on familial ALS prevalence (~10% of all ALS) and ALS1 subset proportion.
source: Cady J et al. (2015). Genetics of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis. Clinical Genetics. 87(3):199-208
